But the One to whom all the spirits of evil are subject and who had given His servants authority over them, was about to bring still greater shame and defeat upon those who despised and profaned His holy name. Sorcery had been prohibited by the Mosaic law, on pain of
238
death, yet from time to time it had been secretly practiced by apostate Jews. At the time of Paul's visit to Ephesus, there were in the city \93certain of the vagabond Jews, exorcists,\94 who, seeing the wonders wrought by him [Paul], \93took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus.\94 An attempt was made by \93seven sons of one Sceva, a Jew, and chief of the priests.\94 Finding a man possessed with a demon, they addressed him, \93We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth.\94 But \93the evil spirit answered and said, Jesus I know, and Paul I know; but who are ye? And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them, and overcame them, and prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded.\94 . . .
